text: Dwight Filley Davis (July 5, 1879 - November 28, 1945) was an American tennis player and politician. He was the founder of the international tennis competition "Davis Cup". He served as United States Secretary of War from 1925 to 1929. Davis died at his home in Washington, D.C. on November 28, 1945, after a six-month illness. ==References== Category:1879 births Category:1945 deaths Category:American tennis players Category:American military personnel of World War I Category:Olympians for the United States Category:Burials at Arlington National Cemetery Category:Harvard University alumni Category:History of tennis Category:Politicians from Missouri Category:Sportspeople from St. Louis, Missouri Category:United States Secretaries of War Category:Military people from Missouri
title: Dwight F. Davis
